data.title: Great place for fresh fish, at a decent price.
data.text:
Great place for fresh fish, great Poke, awesome fish tacos, and now sushi. Great local crowd favorite.
They have a bar and have a varied seafood menu. The prices are just right, and the atmosphere is fun and vibrant.

data.title: Poke and some more poke, please.
data.text: Love this place so much I bought the T-Shirt, though I had to visit their partner store in Huntington Beach to find it.  But that's how much we love their food!  The fish sandwiches and tacos are hard to beat.  Outstanding salsa.  I would like to replicate this restaurant in my home town of Atlanta, please.

data.title: Amazing Fish Tacos
data.text: Visiting family on Bal Boa Island and was introduced to this place for lunch.  Had the blackened Halibut fish tacos and they were AMAZING!!!!   So good....that before we left I had to go back for another lunch.  Definitely worth the stop!  Will be back!

data.title: Delicious Poke
data.text: For me, it was worth the girl unscenic walk from the balboa peninsula . Far enough to cab or uber. The ahi poke was just delicious- right amount of spice, totally fresh, perfect with the chips that came with it. I ordered the half salmon/ half tuna poke. Note that you order at the register.

data.title: Extremely good fresh fish
data.text: This place can smell a little fishy but don't let that scare you away. All the fish is SUPER fresh and delicious. Try the poke tacos!!!

data.title: Fresh and delicious
data.text: We popped in to pick-up some ahi poke and the line was out the door on a late Saturday afternoon. The ahi was delicious! It was sooo good, we went back and got more the next day and some sushi. Everything was fresh, delicious and my mouth is watering just thinking about how good. Cody was really nice and you could tell they are training some new staff, but they were efficient and really polite. Will go back and recommend.

data.title: Keep Pottering Upstream!
data.text: The disorganized lengthy queue intentionally creates the appearance of wild popularity, as the adrift and uninterested galley clerk stoically suggests nothing, conducts the transaction with detached redundant neutrality, and gibingly mutters good luck on your lone journey finding a limited and hardened seat; Several ship bells later, the untrained sea legged server, awkward and disoriented, eventually schleps the mess to the patiently awaiting but now famished mariner, then abruptly disembarks; The chowder is a pasty near clamless, chalky attempt at a potato soup kitchen special. The complimentary self-serve lemon water was noticeably siphoned off; The voraciously consumed paper-plated diminutive shrimp cocktail was marginally redeeming; Self-bussed the remaining chum to its final resting place; Thank goodness the nearby Lido theater hot dog finished the meal. Next time, the mysterious crab cocktail and a tarterless fish taco might surprise this sceptically curious boatswain’s mate.

data.title: I'm not sure why there is always a line out the door
data.text: I have visited Bear Flad on three separate occasions. There is always a long wait for food which, when I have been there, was barely edible. There seems to be a lack of organization and that adds to the long wait time. I will not be back. Don't try to circumvent the line by phoning in your order, your call might just be placed on hold forever!

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Highly recommend! Excellent and fresh seafood. We had the salad with ahi tuna and delicious sesame ginger dressing, and small fish platter. Clam chowder was awesome with huge chunks of clams.

data.title: Best Fish Taco Place
data.text:
I've been back a few times. The fish tacos are great for a couple of reasons. They plenty big and they give you several choices of the type of fish to put in your taco. Very few places have that option.

Last time there I tried a poke burrito. It too was huge and I had the tuna poke. Next time I am going to try the salmon poke burrito, it looked great.

data.title: Fresh fish at a reasonable cost
data.text:
Visiting family in Dana Point I suffered restaurant sticker shock compared to home back in Austin TX. Bear Flag was the exception. Great fresh local seafood and sides. 
If you eat outside you must pass on bear and wine but that's OK.

You will enjoy your meal and your wallet will be happy too.

data.title: Where locals go to eat fresh fish
data.text: You can tell this where the locals go- even our friends in law enforcement.  All of our food was great but be aware this is not a sit down restaurant where they take your order.  You stand in line - check out the fresh fish selection or you may want to ask your order taker about other fish that are available.   You're given a number and you can choose from tables indoors or out.  Even your wine gets corked and you pick it up at the bar with your glasses.  Service is ok- our sushi appetizer came out after we had received our meal, so you may want to consider not doing that or order again after that has been delivered.  The atmosphere was bright a cheerful.  I would go early on a Saturday night.  We got there at 6:30 and by the time we left folks were standing out the door.

data.title: Quick, tasty and fresh!!!
data.text:
Fish taco was delicious, sashimi was top notch, sushi was outstanding...guan was perfect, ceviche was fresh and remarkable.
This place was a hit for my family! Loved it! 
Will be back again!

data.title: Good poke fresh fish
data.text: If you like good fresh fish that is not overly expensive this is the place. Easy to get to when we go to Newport.  Always plenty of parking in the rear of the place. My wife and I have been there several times and have yet to be disappointed.

data.title: Great Burritos
data.text: I had the yellowtail burrito. It was awesome! Great food and great service. I would go back here again! My father had the seafood plateaux we got an order of poke as well!

data.title: Huntington Beach Location
data.text: This place just opened in Huntington Beach at the Pacific City Mall on PCH.  Great view from deck.  The best ever salmon poke. Love this place very fresh and clean.  Great staff and service.

data.title: Great Place. Fresh Seafoood.
data.text: We came here by chance and enjoyed our meal. I had the large fish platter and my friend had the fish tacos. Both were excellent. I highly recommend the clam chowder -- clams at every bite. Prices were also very reasonable for the location.

data.title: Great Clam Chowder
data.text: If you like Clam Chowder, this is the place to come! The best I've ever had! Huge serving size and the fish tacos are fantastic! Noisy inside but very pleasant seating outside on the back patio. Quick service, reasonable prices. One of our favorites!

data.title: Best Fish Taco in Town
data.text: I've only had the fish tacos here because they are so good that I can't bring myself to not order them every time I come here.  This place is super casual, order at counter then eat at mostly outdoor courtyard tables.  They are well known for their poke and fish tacos and they are seriously good - especially with their homemade hot sauce with vinegar.

data.title: Fresh fish
data.text: This seemed to be a very popular spot away from the craziness of the beach side restaurants. The fish was very fresh and great prices. The only downside for me was that the sides were very bland. Yet, it was nice to have a fresh healthy meal. There was a line out of the door when we arrived so it took a little while to get served, but there was plenty of seating. There was also a small sushi bar inside the restaurant. The restaurant offered three fish that were the 'catch of the day', so I assume this changes. This place also has a place people can buy fish to take home and cook. The chips and salsa were also very good! The people in front of us stated that they drive 2 hours to get this restaurants Poke. We walked here from the beach, and it took about 25 minutes each way.
